Sequence Information.Peptide Name: salivaricin A2 (lantibiotic, XXT3; class 1 bacteriocin, natural AMPs; UCLSS1; Gram-positive bacteria, prokaryotes; BBW)

Literature Information.Literature: Chemical modification:three thionine rings: T9-C14, T11-C21, and S17-C22.Activity: Active against M. luteus ATCC 10240 (MIC 2 ug/ml), C. accolens ATCC 49725 (MIC 8 ug/ml), C. accolens KPL 1818 (MIC 16 ug/ml), C. accolens KPL 2060 (MIC 8 ug/ml), C. accolens KPL 2061 (MIC 16 ug/ml), C. pseudodiphtheriticum KPL 1989 (MIC 8 ug/ml), C. striatum KPL 1959 (MIC 32 ug/ml), C. accolens KPL 1855 (MIC 16 ug/ml), S. pneumoniae ATCC 27336 (MIC 32 ug/ml), (MIC 2 ug/ml), S. pneumoniae AI8 (MIC 32 ug/ml), S. pneumoniae AI11 (MIC 16 ug/ml), S. pneumoniae AI14 (MIC 16 ug/ml), S.pneumoniae AI6 (MIC 128 ug/ml), S.pneumoniae AI7 (MIC 128 ug/ml), S.mutans JH1140 (MIC >128 ug/ml), (MIC 16 ug/ml), S. salivarius HS0302 (MIC 64 ug/ml), B.subtilis PY79 (MIC >128 ug/ml), B.megaterium ATCC 14581 (MIC >128 ug/ml), S.epidermidis ERIN 30713 (MIC >128 ug/ml), S.aureus ATCC 25923 (MIC >128 ug/ml), and E.faecalis ERIN 30002 (MIC >128 ug/ml) (Geng et al., 2018).MOA:bacteria: binds to lipid II with low affinity.The original has been merged into AP2378 due to the same sequence 3/2023
Literature Information.Author: Wescombe PA, Upton M, Dierksen KP, Ragland NL, Sivabalan S, Wirawan RE, Inglis MA, Moore CJ, Walker GV, Chilcott CN, Jenkinson HF, Tagg JR. 2006
Literature Information.Title: Production of the lantibiotic salivaricin A and its variants by oral streptococci and use of a specific induction assay to detect their presence in human saliva.
